description: This schema represents the output of a model developed by Kumar et. al. that uses inputs denoting physiological arousal to calculate the probability of a person's being stressed. The schema represents a measurement or the result of aggregating several measurements made over time (see Descriptive statistic schema for a list of aggregate measures)

references.description: The Psychology Ontology code represents Physiological arousal, defined as Condition of alertness and readiness to respond as evidenced by physiological signs such as heart rate or blood pressure.
